         MARKING NOTES
   REMARQUES POUR LA NOTATION
    NOTAS PARA LA CORRECCIÓN


                    May / mai / mayo 2012

        ENGLISH / ANGLAIS / INGLÉS A2


                        Higher Level
                      Niveau Supérieur
                       Nivel Superior


                  Paper / Épreuve / Prueba 2




6 pages/páginas
                          –2–         M12/2/A2ENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




These marking notes are confidential and for the exclusive
use of examiners in this examination session.

They are the property of the International Baccalaureate
and must not be reproduced or distributed to any other
person without the authorisation of IB Cardiff.
                                               –3–           M12/2/A2ENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


Higher Level, paper 2

These notes to examiners are intended only as guidelines to assist marking. They are not offered as
an exhaustive and fixed set of responses or approaches to which all answers must rigidly adhere.
Good ideas or angles not offered here should be acknowledged and rewarded as appropriate.
Similarly, answers which do not include all the ideas or approaches suggested here should not be so
heavily penalized as to distort appreciation of individuality.

These questions invite the candidates to consider the Cultural Option “Language and culture”.

1.   A barely satisfactory answer will offer a general discussion about the connection between
     language and power. One or two examples will be given.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples in its discussion of the strong connection
     between language and power. The essay will have a coherent structure.

     The best answers will demonstrate a range of reasons for the arguments maintained and will
     support those arguments with examples that are pertinent, precise, and varied. The essays will
     be well organized.


2.   A barely satisfactory answer will consider the idea that language is an important means of
     presenting oneself to the world, and will offer a general discussion about what a person’s
     language reveals about him or her. One or two examples will be given.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples in making its argument about what a
     person’s language reveals about him or her. It will have a coherent structure.

     The best answers will demonstrate a range of reasons for the arguments maintained and will
     support those arguments with examples that are pertinent, precise, and varied. The essays will
     be well organized.



These questions invite the candidate to consider the Cultural Option “Media and culture”.

3.   A barely satisfactory answer will offer a general discussion of how young people are
     well informed about advertising strategies and whether or not this has made them more
     critical consumers. One or two examples will be given.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples in making its argument about whether
     well-informed young people are more critical consumers. It will have a coherent structure.

     The best answers will demonstrate a range of reasons for their arguments and will support
     those arguments with examples that are pertinent, precise, and varied. The essays will be
     well organized.
                                                –4–           M12/2/A2ENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


4.   A barely satisfactory answer will make a general argument about whether the mass media can
     function either as tools of revolution or of propaganda. One or two examples will be given.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples in order to argue that the mass media
     can function either as tools of revolution or of propaganda. The essay will have a
     coherent structure.

     The best answers will demonstrate a range of reasons for the arguments maintained and will
     support those arguments with examples that are pertinent, precise, and varied. The essays will
     be well organized.



This question invites the candidates to consider the Cultural Option “Future issues”.

5.   A barely satisfactory answer will offer a general discussion about the ways in which the future
     may or may not improve upon the past. One or two examples will be given.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples in discussing ways in which the future
     may or may not improve upon the past. It will consider the reasons for this in more detail,
     and will have a coherent structure.

     The best answers will demonstrate a range of reasons for the arguments maintained and will
     support those arguments with examples that are pertinent, precise, and varied. The essays will
     be well organized.



This question invites the candidates to consider the Cultural Option “Global issues”.

6.   A barely satisfactory answer will identify two examples of recent global cooperation
     (e.g. political, environmental, cultural, or others) and will explain why they were or were
     not effective. Some focused evidence will be given.

     A better answer will identify two examples of recent global cooperation and will explain
     why they were or were not effective in more detail. It will draw on relevant and
     factual evidence. The essay will have a coherent structure.

     The best answers will identify two examples of recent global cooperation and will draw on
     pertinent, specific and varied evidence to make a persuasive argument regarding whether they
     were or were not effective. The essay will be well organized.
                                                –5–           M12/2/A2ENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


This question invites the candidates to consider the Cultural Option “Social issues”.

7.   A barely satisfactory answer will offer a general discussion of how social isolation affects
     many people and how it can lead to other social problems. One or two examples will
     be given.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples in discussing the idea that social
     isolation affects many people and can lead to other social problems. The essay will have a
     coherent structure.

     The best answers will present pertinent evidence to make a persuasive argument about
     how social isolation affects many groups of people and can lead to other social problems.
     Possible solutions may be offered. The essays will be well organized.



These questions invite the candidates to consider a Literary Option.

8.   A barely satisfactory answer will offer a general discussion of the idea that works of literature
     can often function as social commentary. It will use at least one supporting example from
     each text.

     A better answer will consider in more detail the idea that works of literature can often
     function as social commentary, looking at two or more works studied. The essay will
     demonstrate a good understanding of the texts and will have a coherent structure.

     The best answers will offer a thoughtful, nuanced discussion of the idea of literature as social
     commentary. The essays will demonstrate a thorough understanding of the texts cited, and
     will be well organized and persuasive.


9.   A barely satisfactory answer will explore at least one example of a character who is portrayed
     as “different” in at least two literary works studied.

     A better answer will draw on appropriate examples of characters who are portrayed as
     “different” in at least two literary works. The essay will include some detailed references
     to the texts and will demonstrate a good understanding of them. It will have a
     coherent structure.

     The best answers will use a range of pertinent, precise examples to discuss the portrayal
     of “difference” in two or more literary works studied. Analysis will be thoughtful and will
     take into account differences between and within texts. Essays will be well organized
     and persuasive.
                                                –6–           M12/2/A2ENG/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


10.   A barely satisfactory answer will offer a general discussion of the role of fear in at least two
      literary works studied. It will provide some evidence from each text.

      A better answer will draw on appropriate examples to offer a fuller discussion of the role of
      fear in at least two literary works. It will have a coherent structure.

      The best answers will use a range of pertinent, precise examples to discuss the role of fear in
      two or more works studied. Analysis will be thoughtful and the essays will be well organized
      and persuasive.
